history.content:
I am currently taking 194-34, but of course I have not taken 276. With regards to overlap, I recommend visiting Garg at his OH or emailing him, as he is teaching and will teach 194-34 and has taught CS276 in the past.

Looking at a past offering of CS276: https://people.eecs.berkeley.edu/~sanjamg/classes/cs276-fall16/ , it seems like a bit over 1/3 of the material is covered by 194-34, and there is more emphasis on constructions in 194-34 whereas in 276 there is a huge emphasis on proofs/theory (although there is an expectation of proofs in 194-34) and some cutting-edge research topics.

children.subject:
There are no coding projects, so the closest class from that list is CS 170.  CS 194-34 has weekly written homeworks that have around 3 questions each, but the questions can be difficult.  So far, I think the workload is less than CS 170, but it did take me a while to get used to the mathematical style (e.g. adversarial games, hybrid argument).  Also, there are some "break weeks" where we don't have homeworks due to midterms, unlike CS 170, where we nearly consistently have homeworks each week.

If you've taken CS 161, that is of some help as several of the topics covered overlap.
Jumping on this thread (addressing Phong), what is the workload like for 194-34 compared to other CS classes? As a reference, I've taken 162, 161, 168, 186, 170

history.content: I was hoping to take CS 276 this fall, but sadly it doesn't appear that it's being offered this upcoming fall or spring. I will most likely take 194 in fall regardless since I have heavy interest in the topic, but can anyone speak to the overlap w/ 276? Also, is there any particular reason why 276 isn't being offered? I had planned the last few semesters assuming it would be offered this fall :/
history.subject: CS194-34 overlap w/ CS276?
